question: An 18-year-old girl is diagnosed with Turner's syndrome. What is the most probable chromosomal makeup in this condition?

A 19-year-old female patient comes to the outpatient department (OPD) with the complaint of primary amenorrhea. She has well-developed breasts and pubic hair, but the uterus and vagina are absent. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 19-year-old black, female patient is in her 32nd week of gestation and is admitted to the labor and delivery with a blood pressure of 165/110 mmHg and proteinuria in triage. During her pregnancy, she has suffered from agitation, behavioral changes, and edema. Which of the following best describes her pathogenesis?

answers.option: Abnormal placental vasculature and coagulation abnormalities

question: A 26-year-old married lady comes to the clinic with the complaint of multiple miscarriages. Further inquiry reveals that all her pregnancy losses occurred at 10-12th weeks of gestation. Which of the following best describes the condition?

A 3-month-old male infant is brought to the outpatient department (OPD) for a routine check-up. On thorough examination, it is found that he has cryptorchidism. Which of the following best describes the condition?

answers.option: Accumulation of fluid in the testes
Testes fail to descend into the scrotum

question: A 3-year-old male infant is brought to the clinic after his mother notices urine being expelled from the dorsal aspect of the penis. Abnormality in which of the following embryological structures results in this condition?

A 34-year-old lady comes to the clinic with the complaint of abnormal menstrual bleeding. She reports bleeding for 9 days but the bleeding is regular, occurring after every 28 days. Which of the following best describes the bleeding pattern seen here?
Which of the following is not a remnant of mesonephric ducts in females?
Which of the following is a remnant of paramesonephric duct in males?

A man brings his boy to the hospital as his external urethral orifice is on the ventral aspect of the penis. What is most likely the condition?
Which of the following is correct about secondary oocytes?

answers.option: Oogonia divide to form secondary oocytes
Two polar bodies are formed along with the formation of a secondary oocyte
They are formed after the completion of meiosis-2
They are arrested in prophase-2 approximately 3 hours before ovulation
They have haploid number of chromosomes

Congenital anomalies can lead to the absence of certain organs. In incomplete Mullerian duct aplasia, which of the following would be present?
Which of the following cells are the most immature cells formed during spermatogenesis?
What is the primary source of progesterone in late pregnancy?
Gubernaculum gives rise to which of the following structures in females?
How many oocytes will a normal woman ovulate over her entire reproductive life?
At which stage during spermatogenesis do cells undergo first meiosis?
Which of the following hormones are required for spermatogenesis?
Which of these cells are responsible for the production of testosterone?
What is the term anorchism defined as?

answers.option: Male born with both undescended testes
Male born with one undescended testis

question: Higher than normal levels of progesterone are found in which of the following conditions?
Highly coiled spiral arteries and edema in the endometrium are characteristic of which of the following stages of menstruation?

A 30-year-old female patient is being evaluated for infertility. Serum gonadotropins, estradiol, progesterone, and prolactin levels are measured in a test that is advised to obtain data by a blood sample on her 21st day of menstruation cycle. Which of the following will indicate if the cycle has been ovulatory or not?
Which one of the following options correctly defines infertility?

answers.option: Failure to conceive after three years of unprotected intercourse
Failure to conceive after four years of unprotected intercourse
Failure to conceive after five years of unprotected intercourse
Failure to conceive after six months of unprotected intercourse
Failure to conceive after one year of unprotected intercourse

question: Aromatase is present in which of the following?

A patient presents with meatus showing on the dorsal side of the penis. What is this called?
A patient presents with meatus showing on the ventral side of the penis. What is this called?
Which is false regarding the placenta?

answers.option: There is no mixing of blood
The decidua capsularis is part of the maternal placenta

question: Which of the following is the first hormone secreted by the placenta?

During the development of the male reproductive system, gonadal cords or primitive sex cords develop in the gonadal ridges. These cords give rise to which of the following structures?

The mesonephric ducts or Wolfian ducts play an important role in the development of male genital ducts. Secretions from which of the following have a crucial part in the normal development of these ducts?

answers.option: Vaginal fornices are of urogenital sinus origin
Upper one-third from fused paramesonephric duct
Lower two-third is from surface ectoderm
Vagina upper two-third develops from urogenital sinus
Hymen develop from cells derived from mullerian duct

question: Patients with androgen insensitivity syndrome (AIS) are normal-appearing females with 46 XY chromosome patterns. Internal genitalia of such patients includes which of the following?

Which of the following does not form the placental barrier?
Which of the following structures forms labia minora of the female external genitalia?
Which of the following does not play any part in the formation of the gonadal ridge during the development of the reproductive system?

What is a cotyledon made of?

Which of the following contributes to placental cotyledons?
The sinovaginal bulb gives rise to which structure?
Which structure arises from the paramesonephric duct?
Which of the following structures contributes most significantly to the development of the placenta?

A 20-year-old female presents with primary amenorrhea and cyclic pelvic pain. On examination, secondary sexual characteristics are normal. Imaging reveals a normal uterus and ovaries, but an absence of the lower third of the vagina. Which of the following developmental abnormalities is most likely responsible for her condition?

answers.option: Incomplete fusion of the paramesonephric ducts
Excessive regression of the mesonephric ducts
Absence of migration of primordial germ cells
Failure of the paramesonephric ducts to form
Failure of canalization of the vaginal plate

question: Physical examination of a newborn delivered at 38 weeks gestation showed a urethral opening on the ventral aspect of the penis. Which of the following is the most likely underlying cause of this patient’s findings?

A 15-year-old girl was brought to the clinic with the complaint that “menses have not occurred yet.” A pelvic ultrasound was done that revealed normal ovaries but an absent uterus. Defect in which of the following embryonic structures may be the cause of her condition?
Which of the following structures in females is a derivative of Müllerian ducts?
The placental barrier after the first trimester or after 4th months of intrauterine life is composed of:

answers.option: Syncytiotrophoblast, mesenchymal tissues, and endothelium of blood vessels
Cytotrophoblast, mesenchymal tissues, and endothelium of blood vessels
Cytotrophoblast, syncytiotrophoblast, and endothelium of blood vessels

question: Which of the following is not a correct match of the genital structures and their remnants?

answers.option: Cranial PMN duct — appendix of testis
